meanings.definition: A bar extending from one post or support to another as a fencing or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The wooden rails kept the horses in the field.
meanings.sent2: The metal rails along the edge of the cliff prevented falls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the rails like a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like steel rails, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The bright red rails stood out against the green grass, marking the boundary clearly.

meanings.definition: A track or pair of tracks made of steel or iron for trains to run on.
meanings.sent1: The train glided smoothly along the rails, carrying passengers to their destination.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance crew inspected the rails for any signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the rails were a magical pathway to a distant land.
meanings.sent4: The rails stretched out endlessly, disappearing into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the train wheels on the rails echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: She rails against injustice wherever she sees it.
meanings.sent2: The coach rails at the players for their lack of effort.
meanings.sent3: The toddler decided to rail against bedtime, demanding one more story.
meanings.sent4: His words railed against the corrupt system, calling for change.
meanings.sent5: The teacher railed at the students for not completing their homework on time.
